articles.title: Kim Jong Un Watches Firepower Strike Drill of KPA
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Watches Firepower Strike Drill of KPA
 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and  first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, watched a firepower strike drill of the KPA together with the participants in the 4th meeting of KPA company commanders and political instructors.
					 Kim Jong Un heard a report on the program of the drill and deployment of strike units at the observation post and issued an order to start the drill.
					
					 As soon as the order was issued, nose diving flying corps and various type artillery pieces on the ground fired volleys, pounding   the targets.
					
					 The drill was successfully ended after demonstrating the militant spirit of the heroic KPA under Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un, peerlessly illustrious commander and supreme incarnation of revolutionary faith and pluck. 
					
					 The drill powerfully demonstrated the might of the heroic KPA which has grown to be a matchless powerful army under the care of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He highly appreciated their successes in the drill, expressing great satisfaction over the fact that the participants in the drill were fully prepared to defend the socialist homeland like an impregnable fortress.
					
					 He said that the socialist homeland of Juche is like an invulnerable fortress and the revolutionary cause of the WPK sure to win thanks to the KPA, steel-strong elite ranks.
					
					 He said that this strike drill offered the company commanders and political instructors who participated in the meeting an opportunity to harden their determination to train their companies to be ranks of a-match-for-a-hundred fighters. 
					
					 He expressed great expectation and belief that upon their return to their companies, the company commanders and political instructors of the whole army would put spurs to rounding off the combat preparations and bolstering up the combat capabilities as they had pledged at the meeting and thus turn their companies into invincible combat ranks and elite powerful revolutionary army.
					
					 The drill was watched by Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Yong Gil, Jang Jong Nam, Pyon In Son, Kim Su Kil, Ryom Chol Song, Ri Pyong Chol, Kim Yong Chol, Pak Jong Chon, Rim Kwang Il, Han Kwang Sang, Kim Kyong Ok and commanding officers of armed forces organs.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Has Photo Session with Soldier-builders of KPA Unit 267
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Has Photo Session with Soldier-builders of KPA Unit 267
 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and  first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, had a photo session with the soldier-builders of KPA Unit 267 who performed labor feats in building splendid edifices in the era of Songun.
					 At its venue he congratulated the soldier-builders on fully displaying the militant stamina and the spirit of devotedly carrying out orders as a guard unit and hero unit in the great worksites of socialist construction as befitting the defenders of the country and creators of people's happiness.
					
					 The Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, the apartment houses for educators of Kim Il Sung University, Munsu Water Park and Mirim Riding Club and many other monumental edifices are associated with the patriotic devotion and ennobling efforts of the commanding officers and service personnel of the unit who took the lead in upholding the plans of the Party, he said, highly appreciating their successes. Then he had a photo session with them.
					
					 He expressed expectation and belief that the commanding officers and soldier-builders of KPA Unit 267 would perform their pioneer role in the future, too, in the new projects for building a thriving nation which the Party would entrust to them.

articles.title: Mongolian President Meets Pak Pong Ju
articles.content:
Mongolian President Meets Pak Pong Ju
 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Mongolian President Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj Wednesday met with Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.
					 Present there were Luvsanvandan Bold, minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade, Manibadrakh Ganbold, Mongolian ambassador to the DPRK, Khaltmaa Battulga, minister of Industry and Agriculture, Lundeg Purevsuren, national security and foreign policy advisor to the President, and officials concerned.
					
					 Also on hand were Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Pak Kil Yon, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Son Kwang Ho, vice-minister of Physical Culture and Sports, Hong Kyu, DPRK ambassador to Mongolia, and officials concerned.
					
					 The talk took place in a friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: Mongolian President Meets Choe Thae Bok
articles.content:
Mongolian President Meets Choe Thae Bok
 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Mongolian President Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj Wednesday met and had a friendly talk with Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) who paid a courtesy call on him, at the state guest house in the Flower Garden.
					 Present there were Pak Kil Yon, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Hong Kyu, DPRK ambassador to Mongolia, and officials concerned.
					
					 Also on hand were Luvsanvandan Bold, minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade, Manibadrakh Ganbold, Mongolian ambassador to the DPRK, Khaltmaa Battulga, minister of Industry and Agriculture, Lundeg Purevsuren, national security and foreign policy advisor to the President, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Mongolian President Lays Wreath before Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong
articles.content:
Mongolian President Lays Wreath before Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong
 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Mongolian President Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj together with his wife and suite members laid a wreath before the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong Wednesday.
					 Present there were Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister, Cha Hui Rim, chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, and Hong Gyu, DPRK ambassador to Mongolia.
					
					 A wreath was placed before the cemetery in the name of the Mongolian president.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of the anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters who laid down their precious lives in the sacred battles for the liberation of the country, the freedom and happiness of the people and the revolutionary cause of Juche under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung and the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 The Mongolian president and his party laid bouquets before the bust of Kim Jong Suk and observed a moment's silence in memory of the anti-Japanese war hero.
					
					 The guests went round the cemetery.

articles.title: Korean, Mongolian Children Had Mixed Soccer Match
articles.content:
Korean, Mongolian Children Had Mixed Soccer Match
 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- A mixed soccer match of Korean and Mongolian children took place at Kim Il Sung Stadium on Wednesday. 
					 It was enjoyed by Mongolian President Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj and his suite members on a state visit to the DPRK and staff members of the Mongolian embassy. 
					
					 Among the spectators were Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, officials concerned, citizens and schoolchildren. 
					
					 The players of the two countries entered the stadium, warmly welcomed and applauded by the spectators. 
					
					 Prior to the match the Mongolian president went down to the football field to encourage the players of both countries and have a photo taken with them.
					
					 They competed, being divided into Red Team and White Team. 
					
					 The match helped deepen friendship between the peoples and schoolchildren of the two countries.

articles.title: Photo, Art Exhibition Marks Anniversary of DPRK-Sweden Diplomatic Ties
articles.content:
Photo, Art Exhibition Marks Anniversary of DPRK-Sweden Diplomatic Ties
 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- A photo and art exhibition opened with due ceremony at the Pyongyang Centre for Cultural Exchange with Foreign Countries on Wednesday to mark the 40th anniversary of the establishment of the DPRK-Sweden diplomatic ties. 
					 Present at the opening ceremony were So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is chairman of the DPRK-Sweden Friendship Association, officials concerned, citizens and Karl Olof Andersson, Swedish ambassador to the DPRK, and a staff member of the embassy. 
					
					 Invited to the ceremony were embassy officials of different countries and members of the missions of international organizations here. 
					
					 Speeches were made there. 
					
					 The participants looked around photos and art pieces showing history, culture and customs of Sweden.

articles.title: Staff Members of Chinese Embassy Help Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Staff Members of Chinese Embassy Help Korean Farmers
 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Hongcai and staff members of his embassy did friendship work at the DPRK-China Friendship Thaekam Co-op Farm in Sunan District, Pyongyang on Wednesday.
					 The guests helped farmers in their farm work.
					
					 They then went round the DPRK-China friendship room and kindergarten before talking with officials of the farm.
					
					 The ambassador wished the farm greater success in the grain production. 
					
					 They conveyed a certificate of farming materials presentation and aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: Fruit Farmers Move into New Houses
articles.content:
Fruit Farmers Move into New Houses 
 Kosan, October 30 (KCNA) -- Farmers began moving into new dwelling houses in the Kosan Fruit Farm of Kangwon Province, the DPRK Wednesday amid congratulations of officials concerned and members of the Construction Shock Brigade 618. The houses are in harmony with the picturesque orchard that has turned into a large-scale fruit producer.
					 Shock brigade members built more than 510 dwelling houses at the foot of mountains in various areas.
					
					 The new villages with hospitals, welfare and service establishments and other living amenities will help the dwellers lead a happier life and work hard to boost production. 
					
					 The farmers expressed thanks to the Workers' Party of Korea for the new houses.

articles.title: Kim Jung Su, DPRK's Meritorious Scientist
articles.content:
Kim Jung Su, DPRK's Meritorious Scientist
 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Prof. and Dr. Kim Jung Su, who is also a candidate academician, is the director of the Surface Activity Institute at Chongjin University of Mining and Metallurgy of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 After graduating from Kim Il Sung University more than 50 years ago, he worked as a teacher and a department head at the university before becoming the director of the institute.
					
					 Under his guidance, a number of students have won academic degrees.
					
					 He wrote some 70 theses and 30 textbooks and reference books, including "Chemistry on Flotation Reagents" and "Flotation Reagents".
					
					 He also developed over 20 kinds of ore-dressing reagents and sorted out four kinds of nano and subnano matters from industrial wastes, with which he managed to make 10 kinds of sci-tech products, thus rendering a big benefit to the state.
					
					 He was awarded 50 certificates of national scientific and technological successes, some of which are national inventions certificates.
					
					 He won high appraisal at the national sci-tech presentation in the field of nano-technology and the 28th national scientific and technological festival, which were held last year and this year.
					
					 In recent years, he wrote "Encyclopedia of Ore-Dressing Reagent", classified into three volumes.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Ridicules S. Korean Puppet Forces' Rigmaroles
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Ridicules S. Korean Puppet Forces' Rigmaroles 
 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet forces are these days slandering the principled stand of the DPRK on the situation prevailing on the Korean Peninsula. They talk rubbish that the tough steps taken by the DPRK are little short of hyping again the strategy for "engaging the U.S. and blocking south Korea" as a "gesture" to attract the U.S. attention. They also claim that there is little possibility that the situation will develop as desired by the north due to the consistent stand of the U.S. administration that the improvement of the inter-Korean relations is a "premise for the mending of north Korea-U.S. relations".
					 This is a mean and base way of thinking of a colonial servant. The traitors are making such tongue-lashing, not feeling ashamed of having vitiated the atmosphere of dialogue while talking about "theory of principle" though it had developed favorably. This is nothing but a cynical ploy to divert elsewhere world public criticism of them who derailed inter-Korean dialogue and deteriorated the situation. "Engaging the U.S. and blocking south Korea" touted by them only betrays their ulterior intention.
					
					 "Engaging the U.S." may be a serious issue for the puppet regime as it has to read the U.S. face in all matters while kowtowing to it but it is nothing to do with the DPRK. If it is in the interests of the country and the nation, the DPRK will can engage or block the U.S. as it pleases.
					
					 Whether the DPRK opts for bilateral or multilateral talks is ultimately aimed to put an end to the U.S. threat of a nuclear war on the Korean Peninsula and hand a new nuclear-free world to the nation and posterity.
					
					 This is because attaching importance to the nation is the principled stand the DPRK has firmly maintained as regards the common interests of the nation. Proceeding from this, the DPRK advised the Park Geun Hye group to think and act from the stand of giving importance to the nation when it was making a new war drumbeat together with foreign forces after taking office and trumpeted about "the north's sincere dismantlement of its nukes" and begged for "cooperation in pressurize the north" during its foreign trips. But what Park and her group did was perfidious.
					
					 The group has cried out for "bringing down the north's regime" while talking about "leading the north to  changes" but unconditionally served foreign forces while vociferating about "tightened blood alliance" with them.
					
					 The group has taken the lead in helping its master in its moves to stifle the DPRK, ignoring sincere efforts and magnanimity of fellow countrymen. Does it have any face to grumble about "engaging the U.S. and blocking south Korea."
					
					 The humiliating diplomacy towards foreign forces is a "state policy" of the Park group. It is   a product of the master-servant political relations.
					
					 With no rhetoric can the Park group justify its cursed behaviors as it is prolonging its remaining days as political prostitutes while still leaving everything to the tender mercy of its master.
					
					 Looking back on history, all puppet forces met miserable ends for being totally submissive to the U.S.
					
					 Park and her group had better bear this deep in mind.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Brands Park Geun Hye as Lackey of Japan
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Brands Park Geun Hye as Lackey of Japan
 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet "government" conveyed to the U.S. its intention to allow Japan's "right to collective self-defense" under conditions. 
					 The meeting of the Japan-U.S. security consultative committee held in Tokyo recently agreed to amend the "U.S.-Japan Defense Cooperation Guidelines" in the direction of recognizing Japan's exercise of that right. The south Korean authorities okayed this agreement. 
					
					 This means joining in the rebellion of history which may shake the foundation of postwar system that has been maintained in Northeast Asia since the end of World War II. So it is an act of treachery paving the way for Japan's reinvasion. 
					
					 Now the U.S. pins great hope on Japan's growing military potential and its increasing role in carrying out its Asia-Pacific strategy for aggression. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are now working hard to launch undisguised overseas aggression by pulling down the barrier banning Japan's overseas military actions after the war under the signboard of exercise of the "right to collective self-defense." 
					
					 It was against this backdrop that the Park Geun Hye group of south Korea unhesitatingly supported the Japanese reactionaries' moves for reinvasion which the successive rulers of south Korea dared not do. 
					
					 What it is now doing is the thrice-cursed act of treachery being perpetrated by it oblivious of the distress-torn history of the Korean nation caused by the Japanese imperialists. 
					
					 Japan has appeared as the most dangerous aggressor force in Asia, backed by such apostates of history as the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces. It has emerged a more dangerous war state than what it used to be in the 20th century. 
					
					 The DPRK is the primary target of Japan's overseas aggression. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities supported Japan's exercise of the "right to collective self-defense" now that the U.S.-Japan-south Korea triangular military alliance is becoming a reality. This cannot be construed otherwise than an attempt to launch a war against the north, backed by outside forces. 
					
					 The Koreans suffered bitterer disgrace than what others did, while undergoing distress due to the colonial rule of Japan in the last century. 
					
					 However, the Park Geun Hye regime less than one year old is going to repeat this disgraceful history. It seems that the "yusin" dictator has already revived. He was praised as "a final soldier of the Imperial Japanese Army" after making his oath in blood to "be loyal to the Emperor unto death."
					
					 It is the bitter lesson taught by the history of the Korean nation that if a man takes in flunkeyism, he is bound to be a fool and if a nation pursues flunkeyism, it is bound to go to ruin. 
					
					 If they are members of the nation, they should come to their senses and roll back their anachronistic sycophantic and country-selling policies, though belatedly.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Assails Park Geun Hye's Sycophancy toward Foreign Forces
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Assails Park Geun Hye's Sycophancy toward Foreign Forces
 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Overseas Korean Kang Yong Nam, a member of the "Meeting of Hating Park Geun Hye", sent the following article to KCNA on Tuesday:
					 Recorded in the disgraceful history of the Feudal Joson Dynasty (1392-1910) are sycophantic acts of Minbi (1851-1895) who turned Korea into a scene of scramble among big powers. She brought Japs under the pretext of improving relations with Japan right after becoming the Queen and then the U.S. and European powers one after another under the pretext of resisting Japs. In the long run, she was cruelly killed in the Royal Palace by aggressors of Japan to which she kowtowed.
					
					 Park Geun Hye of south Korea seems to follow in the footsteps of Minbi who met a tragic death.
					
					 Park is the daughter of the "yusin" dictator who was shot to death by the south Korean CIA chief at the prodding of his U.S. master after staking his lot on the U.S. and Japan. She is now busy pleasing big powers the same bad way her father did.
					
					 She formally signed the "tailored deterrence strategy", a U.S. scenario for a nuclear war against the DPRK, taking the lead in the moves to carry out the U.S. policy toward the DPRK. She is frequently introducing U.S. nuclear carriers, strategic bombers and other nuclear strike means into south Korea and joining the U.S. in its moves to establish the missile defense system aimed to secure strategic edge over big powers in the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 Recently she did such stupid things as allowing Japan's exercise of the "right to collective self-defense" which it has sought to reinvade Asia.
					
					 She is trying hard to improve her image while currying favor with China but it clearly sees through her regime's cunning acts of threatening peace and stability in the continent, backed by the U.S. and Japan. It is the Park group which introduced U.S. aircraft carrier flotilla and other strategic nuclear strike means in the eyes of China and supported Japan in its moves to grab Diaoyu islands.
					
					 The Park group is unable to get rid of the clutches of big powers though the situation is getting serious. This is the physiology and fate of this group of traitors.
					
					 As the U.S. Economist on October 26 reported, world public is labeling the "confidence-building politics" touted by Park as "politics of distrust" as she is keen on depending on foreign forces after turning her back on follow countrymen. The Park group is a horde of sycophants and traitors worse than the Lee Myung Bak group which was tried by history for being modern-day "five traitors of 1905." 
					
					 "Confidence-building politics", like "no nukes, opening and 3 000 dollars", is bound to lead to humiliation and self-destruction.
					
					 If Park Geun Hye persists in the acts putting the erstwhile traitors into the shade, oblivious of the tragedy of the nation's history, she will not be able to escape the same misfortune as what her father suffered.

articles.title: "Confidence-Building Process" Is Source of North-South Distrust, Confrontation: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
"Confidence-Building Process" Is Source of North-South Distrust, Confrontation: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- The "confidence-building process", the "policy toward the north" touted by the south Korean authorities, is the anti-reunification policy aimed to fan up the distrust and hostility between the north and the south and escalate the confrontation with compatriots.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in an article in this regard:
					
					 The puppet forces alleged that "confidence-building process" is based on "firm security" and "substantial deterrence forces". This goes to clearly prove that the "policy toward the north" pursued by the south Korean authorities is, in a fact, a war policy to justify the military provocation and showdown with the use of force.
					
					 Dialogue between the north and the south suspended and distrust increased owing to the puppet forces' deliberate and premeditated moves of using the dialogue for escalating confrontation with compatriots under the "confidence-building process".
					
					 The attitude toward the north-south declarations is a touchstone distinguishing whether they want to improve the inter-Korean relations or not.
					
					 In view of this, the "confidence-building process" goes quite contrary to the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					 The declarations call for multi-faceted dialogue and cooperation but the "confidence-building process" refuses full-scale dialogue and cooperation under the pretext of the nuclear issue. 
					
					 The situation clearly proves the anti-reunification nature of the "confidence-building process" as the source of escalating confrontation with compatriots.
					
					 The puppet authorities let loose a spate of vituperation to give impression that they are concerned about improving the inter-Korean relations while talking about the "confidence-building process". This is an unpardonable mockery and insult to all the compatriots at home and abroad aspiring after independent reunification, peace and prosperity.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK Remarks under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK Remarks under Fire
 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- South Korean puppet Foreign Minister Yun Pyong Se in a recent speech made on the Day of the United Nations malignantly slandered the DPRK, describing its access to nukes as a "challenge to the UN."
					 Minister of Unification Ryu Kil Jae in a "special lecture" made rubbish that the "nuclear issue of the north should be settled" in order to turn the Kaesong Industrial Zone into a "fully mature industrial complex."
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 Such confrontation remarks can be made by those who are steeped in hostility toward compatriots to the marrow of their bones and obsessed with anti-DPRK nuclear racket.
					
					 Their moves are a blatant challenge to the dignity and sovereignty of the DPRK, a foolish attempt to realize their ambition to force the DPRK to "scrap nuclear program first" in collusion with foreign forces and to carry out their scenario for invading it, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 They only seek the sinister aim for confrontation of social systems between the north and the south of Korea, in disregard of the destiny of the nation. This is evidenced by the fact that they are speaking ill of the strategic line of the DPRK on simultaneously pushing forward the economic construction and the building of nuclear force, while resorting to the nuclear racket against the DPRK in league with the U.S., far from making efforts to save the inter-Korean relations from crisis.
					
					 They had better honestly look back on their crimes of increasing the danger of nuclear war on the Korean Peninsula and derailing the inter-Korean dialogue and cooperation before crying out for "north's cancellation of the nuclear program".
					
					 The nuclear deterrence of the DPRK is by no means a bargaining chip for getting something.
					
					 Those who incite confrontation while daring slander the just line of the DPRK will be made to pay a dear price.

articles.title: Japan's Chief Executive Accused of His Attempt at Visit to Yasukuni Shrine
articles.content:
Japan's Chief Executive Accused of His Attempt at Visit to Yasukuni Shrine
 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, 159 Dietmen of Japan thronged to Yasukuni Shrine in Tokyo under the pretext of the great memorial service in the autumn season to attend the service. Japanese Chief Executive Abe made an ornamental offering to the shrine in his name, not visiting it.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This reveals a sinister attempt of Abe to evade worldwide protest and denunciation against the visit to the shrine and fan up the atmosphere of the visit to it by Japanese politicians.
					
					 Not content with making an ornamental offering, Abe is looking to visit it during his tenure of office.
					
					 His attempt is nothing but an indication of his real intention to justify the past war of aggression stained with blood, eulogize special-class war criminals as "heroes" and "patriots" and let Japanese opt for a war of reinvasion by following them. This is evidenced by the fact that Abe used every opportunity to let loose a spate of rhetoric that the visit to Yasukuni Shrine is internal affairs and to pay respect for those who laid down their lives in actions for the sake of the country is a common practice in any other country.
					
					 The arrogant and shameless act of the Japanese reactionaries running headlong into militarization, far from repenting of the history of aggression, is further increasing the hatred for Japan of the Koreans and other Asian people who suffered huge mental and material damage by the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 Those who move to repeat the history of crimes are bound to meet punishment. If they are politicians with normal way of thinking, they should stop such a foolish act as pricking their eyes with their own hands.
					
					 There will be no future for Japan unless it liquidates its past.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Suppression of Progressive Forces Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Suppression of Progressive Forces Slammed 
 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Kyong Ryol, vice-chairman of the Central Association of Korean Nationals in Russia, Monday made public a statement in denunciation of the south Korean puppet authorities' move to forcibly dissolve the Unified Progressive Party (UPP).
					 The statement referred to the fact that the south Korean conservative group is making desperate efforts to forcibly dissolve the UPP, a legitimate political party. 
					
					 The group has suppressed the UPP for having conducted just activities for independence and democracy in south Korean society and national reunification, after labeling it "enemy of liberal democracy" and "political party following the north". Not content with this, the group is working with bloodshot eyes to totally dissolve the UPP, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 This is a blatant challenge to the south Korean people desirous of social democracy and genuine freedom of political activities and a fascist repressive racket to eliminate the pro-reunification patriotic forces. 
					
					 Such politically-motivated repressive act to forcibly dissolve a political party for the mere reason that it desires progress and pursues different political idea from the group is a tragedy that can be seen in south Korea only.
					
					 The campaign kicked off by the conservative group to eliminate the progressive forces including the UPP is aimed to divert elsewhere the growing criticism of it owing to the Intelligence Service's interference in the election and tide over its political crisis. 
					
					 The south Korean puppet conservative group should clearly know that the more desperately it hatches fascist plots and kicks up a repressive racket contrary to the trend of the times, the stronger resistance and condemnation of south Koreans and all other compatriots it will face and the sterner judgment of history it will meet.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye Urged to Make Apology for Illegal Interference in Election
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye Urged to Make Apology for Illegal Interference in Election 
 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Progress of south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on October 25, demanding Park Geun Hye apologize and own responsibility for the illegal interference in the election.
					 It was proved by substantial evidence that not only the Intelligence Service (IS) but also the Ministry of Defense and the Patriots and Veterans Affairs Agency illegally interfered in the "presidential election" last year, the organization charged.
					
					 It queried is there any difference between the 2012 election, in which a power organ was involved in an organized manner to misrepresent public opinion, and the March 15 election rigging in 1960. 
					
					 The present situation in which the IS is riding roughshod after terming the opposition the enemy of the "government" and the target to be stamped out is reminiscent of the "yusin" period, it said.
					
					 What matters is Park Geun Hye's behavior, the organization noted, adding she is turning her face away from the will of the people behind the "Saenuri Party" and trying to change the situation by enforcing an anachronistic fascist rule.
					
					 The organization demanded Park apologize for the illegal interference in the election, own responsibility for it, fire all those involved in it and punish them.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye Urged to Own Responsibility for IS's Case
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye Urged to Own Responsibility for IS's Case
 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore on October 25 editorially demanded the chief executive own responsibility for the case of the illegal interference in the election.
					 The editorial denounced Park Geun Hye for keeping mum as ever about the Intelligence Service (IS), military and other institutions' interference in the election.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The situation is getting worse as the days go by, but the chief executive turns her face away from the case, behaving as if she had nothing to do with it. Keeping silence beyond the tolerance limit amounts to an act of evading responsibility.
					
					 Not only the people but also conservative forces are becoming increasingly vocal that only the apology from the Park regime and thorough investigation can resolve the IS's case.
					
					 Park's attitude of showing no concern over the illegal election was the main cause of the deterioration of public mind-set.
					
					 Park should check the pressure from outside to make sure that the truth about the IS's case is properly probed and own a political and legal responsibility for the attempts to cover up the truth about various cases after the election, urged the editorial.

articles.title: Anachronistic Assertions for "Yusin" Dictatorship Slammed
articles.content:
Anachronistic Assertions for "Yusin" Dictatorship Slammed
 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Kyunghyang Daily News on October 27 carried an article in denunciation of the racket of praising the "yusin" dictatorship.
					 The article recalled that "memorial services" for Park Chung-Hee took place in Seoul and other parts of south Korea on October 26.
					
					 It said: Lawmakers and chiefs of county and other offices talked rubbish extolling Park Chung-Hee and praising the "yusin" dictatorship and the May 16 military coup. Not content with these ridiculous behaviors, they even said the "'yusin' era was better."
					
					 To embellish the "yusin" dictatorship now that the "emergency measure" which supported the "yusin" was a violation of law is obviously a criminal act.
					
					 Since the emergence of the Park Guen Hye regime, there were events openly held in different parts of south Korea to praise Park Chung-Hee.
					
					 The article warned the ruling quarters not to allow any more anachronistic assertions.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Accused of Seizing Power by Dint of Injustice, Lies
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Accused of Seizing Power by Dint of Injustice, Lies
 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- The Justice and Peace Commission of the Kwangju Archdiocese of the Catholic Church of south Korea issued a statement on October 24 urging a right solution to the case of the puppet Intelligence Service's (IS) interference in the "presidential election".
					 The statement said that the IS made no scruple of perpetrating illegal acts such as  misleading public opinion, keeping in touch with the cyber command of the army and the team for cyber election campaign of the "Saenuri Party".
					
					 Detailed facts about the IS illegal interference in the past "presidential election" were brought to light, the statement noted.
					
					 It added that despite all these illegal acts, the "government" is keen to cover up its crimes.
					
					 The statement deplored south Korean society is returning to the era of the "yusin" dictatorship when the intelligence agency controlled all power organs.
					
					 The ruling forces' illegal interference in the election and their attempt to cover it up go to prove that the present "government" grabbed power by dint of injustice and lies, it charged.
					
					 The statement urged the Park regime to thoroughly probe the truth about the IS interference in the election and apologize for it.

articles.title: WPK's Important Days Marked by Foreign Media
articles.content:
WPK's Important Days Marked by Foreign Media
 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Media of foreign countries dedicated special write-ups to the 68th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the 87th anniversary of the Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU) in the period from October 17 to 23.
					 The Nepalese newspaper Gorkha Express carried an article titled "Nearly 70 years of leading the people".
					
					 The article gave a detailed account of the fact that the WPK has victoriously advanced the cause of socialism without the slightest mistake or deviation from its line despite all difficulties and trials of history.
					
					 The Brazilian Committee for Remembering General Secretary Kim Jong Il posted an article titled "87th anniversary of DIU" on its website.
					
					 The article said:
					
					 October 17, 1926 is the day when President Kim Il Sung, founder of socialist Korea, formed the DIU.
					
					 Nearly 90 years covered by the Korean revolution is a pride history in which the WPK has won victories only under the uplifted banner of independence, Songun and socialism held high by the DIU.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK are now making a new history of Songun Korea under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Only victory and glory are in store for the Korean army and people carrying forward the great tradition of the DIU under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Indian newspaper Indian and World Event in its article titled "The historic roots of the WPK" said:
					
					 The formation of the DIU marked a historic event of special significance in the carving out of the destiny of the Korean people and the modern history of Korea.
					
					 The WPK, a guiding force of Korean society, struck its historic roots in the DIU.
					
					 The WPK is now powerfully encouraging the Korean people in the struggle to build a thriving socialist nation holding Kim Jong Un in high esteem as its first secretary.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle for National Reunification Introduced by Mexican Paper
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle for National Reunification Introduced by Mexican Paper
 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- The Mexican newspaper Unidad Nacional on October 15 carried an article titled "DPRK's struggle for achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country" illustrated with a photo of Marshal Kim Jong Un acknowledging the enthusiastic cheers of service personnel of the Korean People's Army.
					 The paper said that the 65-year-long history of the DPRK is the period in which it has waged a strenuous struggle to achieve the country's reunification by the concerted efforts of all Koreans under the banner of independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity.
					
					 The 1970s witnessed the publication of the historic July 4 joint statement in which the three principles of national reunification were clarified, and in the 1980s and the 1990s the desire for independent reunification reached the height all over Korea.
					
					 Today the idea of "By our nation itself" serves as one common to the Korean nation desirous of the reunification of the country.

articles.title: DPRK FM Spokesman's Statement Supported by Peruvian Organization
articles.content:
DPRK FM Spokesman's Statement Supported by Peruvian Organization
 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian Committee for Friendship and Solidarity with Peoples issued a statement on October 24 in support of the statement issued by the DPRK Foreign Ministry spokesman on October 23 in connection with the fact that the U.S. is again rendering the situation on the Korean Peninsula tense and escalating confrontation.
					 The statement said:
					
					 Recently the situation on the peninsula has escalated due to the U.S. nuclear threat and war drills.
					
					 The U.S. is the root cause of misfortune, wars and disputes not only on the Korean Peninsula but around the world.
					
					 The U.S. and its followers are conducting war drills in south Korea one after another and posing threats to the DPRK with nuclear war means, a foolish and fruitless act, unaware of the might of the DPRK.
					
					 The imperialist enemies should properly understand that the DPRK has the powerful deterrent for self-defence and that it is led by Marshal Kim Jong Un, invincible and iron-willed Songun commander.
					
					 In order to realize the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula desired by the Korean people and world progressive people, it is essential for the U.S. to sincerely implement the existing agreements.
					
					 We fully support the DPRK's will and efforts for the denuclearization of the peninsula and strongly reject the U.S. and its followers' moves for provoking a nuclear war.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige competencia de tiro de jefes e instructores politicos de companias de EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige competencia de tiro de jefes e instructores politicos de companias de EPC
Pyongyang, 30 de octubre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio la competencia de tiro de los participantes en la 4a conferencia de jefes e instructores politicos de companias del EPC.
					El Mariscal respondio cordialmente a las efusivas aclamaciones de todos los participantes y dijo que esta muy alegre por encontrarse otra vez con los fidedignos jefes e instructores politicos de companias, con quienes tiene ganas de reunirse cada dia.
					
					Se refirio al objetivo de la presente competencia sin precedente en la historia de la construccion del ejercito.
					
					Diciendo que si los militares no tienen talentos de tiro aunque sean bien preparados tanto en lo ideo-politico como en lo fisico, no pueden cumplir con satisfaccion las misiones de combate asumidas, apunto que cuando los jefes e instructores politicos tienen buen arte de tiro, pueden formar a todos los uniformados como tiradores excelentes.
					
					Senalo que organizo la presente competencia en aras de hacer mas fuerte en todo el ejercito el fervor del movimiento por ser tiradores y artilleros celebres.
					
					La competencia se efectuo definiendo los ordenes por tipos de ejercito, categorias de cuerpo de ejercito e individuales segun las notas alcanzadas por los jefes e instructores politicos de companias seleccionados entre los participantes en la conferencia quienes acertaron los blancos desde las posiciones durante el tiempo determinado.
					
					Los tiradores mostraron sus artes de tiro adiestrados en los dias cotidianos.
					
					El Comandante Supremo dio aplausos con amplia sonrisa cada vez que los tiradores alcanzaban buenas notas acertando exactamente los blancos.
					
					En la competencia la unidad 233 y la otra 604 del EPC ocuparon primeros lugares, las 287 y 318 del EPC de las fuerzas navales del EPC se clasificaron segundas y las 549 y 569, terceras.
					
					En los rangos individuales, el instructor politico de compania adscrita a la unidad 380 del EPC, Ri Yong Chol, el instructor politico Kang Un Chol y la jefa de compania Pak In Suk, adscritos a la unidad 604 del EPC ocuparon primeros lugares; el jefe de compania adscrita a la unidad 488 del EPC, Ri Sang Chol se puso en segundo lugar y el tercer lugar correspondio al instructor politico de compania adscrita a la unidad 313 del EPC, Jon Yong Gol, el jefe de compania adscrita a la unidad 233, Ri Kwang Hyok, la jefa de compania adscrita a la unidad 549, Sung Myong Sim, el jefe de compania adscrita a la unidad 593, Kim Kwang Hyon y la jefa de compania adscrita a la unidad 287, Han Ok Ju, respectivamente.
					
					Al cabo de la competencia hubo la premiacion.
					
					El Comandante Supremo senalo que a traves de la competencia los jefes e instructores politicos de companias hayan sido bien conscientes de que pueden formar a todos los militares como tiradores y artilleros celebres, cuando se preparen ellos mismos como tiradores famosos y aclaro las tareas y remedios que presentan en intensificar el entrenamiento de tiro.
					
					La vieron el vicemariscal del EPC, Choe Ryong Hae, jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, el general de ejercito de las fuerzas terrestres del EPC, Ri Yong Gil, jefe de Estado Mayor General del EPC, el general del ejercito de las fuerzas terrestres del EPC, Jang Jong Nam, ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, los miembros de mando de los organos de las fuerzas armadas, los jefes e instructores politicos de companias participantes en la conferencia.

articles.title: Presidente de Mongolia se reune con premier coreano Pak Pong Ju
articles.content:
Presidente de Mongolia se reune con premier coreano Pak Pong Ju
Pyongyang, 30 de octubre (ACNC) -- El presidente de Mongolia, Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj, se reunio hoy en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con el premier de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Pong Ju.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores y Comercio, Luvsanvandan Bold, el embajador mongol en Corea, Manibadrakh Ganbold, el ministro de Industria y Agricultura, Khaltmaa Battulga, el asesor del presidente para la Seguridad Nacional y la Politica Exterior, Lundeg Purevsuren, y otras personalidades.
					
					Estuvieron presentes el ministro de Comercio Exterior, Ri Ryong Nam, el viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores, Pak Kil Yon, el viceministro de Deportes, Son Kwang Ho, el embajador coreano en Mongolia, Hong Kyu.
					
					Las conversaciones transcurrieron en una atmosfera amistosa.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok realiza visita de cortesia al presidente de Mongolia
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok realiza visita de cortesia al presidente de Mongolia
Pyongyang, 30 de octubre (ACNC) -- El presidente de Mongolia Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj departio el dia 28 en un clima amistoso con el presidente de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Choe Thae Bok, quien le hizo una visita de cortesia a la Casa de Huespedes del Estado Paekhwawon.
					Aqui participaron el viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores, Pak Kil Yon, el embajador coreano en Mongolia, Hong Kyu, y otros funcionarios.
					
					Estuvieron presentes los acompanantes del mandatario visitante: el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores y Comercio, Luvsanvandan Bold, el embajador mongol en Corea Manibadrakh Ganbold, el ministro de Industria y Agricultura, Khaltmaa Battulga, el asesor del presidente para la Seguridad Nacional y la Politica Exterior, Lundeg Purevsuren, y otras personalidades.

articles.title: Presidente mongol recorre Cementerio de Martires Revolucionarios de Monte Taesong
articles.content:
Presidente mongol recorre Cementerio de Martires Revolucionarios de Monte Taesong
Pyongyang, 30 de octubre (ACNC) -- Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj, presidente de Mongolia, coloco hoy una ofrenda floral en el Cementerio de Martires Revolucionarios del Monte Taesong.
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion la esposa del presidente y su comitiva, asi como el canciller coreano Pak Ui Chun, el presidente del Comite Popular de la Ciudad de Pyongyang Cha Hui Rim y el embajador coreano en Mongolia Hong Gyu.
					
					Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria de los martires revolucionarios antijaponeses quienes en acato a la sabia orientacion del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Partido del Trabajo de Corea dedicaron su valiosa vida a la lucha por la emancipacion del pais, la libertad y felicidad del pueblo y el cumplimiento de la causa revolucionaria del Juche.
					
					El presidente visitante y su comitiva depositaron ramos de flores al pie del busto de Kim Jong Suk, Heroina de la Lucha Armada Antijaponesa, y guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria de ella.
					
					Los huespedes recorrieron el cementerio.

articles.title: Tiene lugar partido de equipos mixtos infantiles de Corea y Mongolia
articles.content:
Tiene lugar partido de equipos mixtos infantiles de Corea y Mongolia
Pyongyang, 30 de octubre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 30 en el Estadio Kim Il Sung el partido de futbol entre los equipos mixtos de ninos coreanos y mongoles.
					Lo vieron Su Excelencia Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj, Presidente de Mongolia, quien realiza una visita estatal a Corea, y su comitiva y los miembros de la sede diplomatica mongolesa en Corea.
					
					Tambien estuvieron presentes el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, otros funcionarios de la rama interesada, trabajadores, jovenes y ninos escolares en la capital. 
					
					Los espectadores dieron calurosa bienvenida a los futbolistas infantiles de los dos paises quienes entraban en la cancha.
					
					Antes del juego, el mandatario mongol bajo al campo para animar a los jugadores de dos paises y se fotografio junto a ellos.
					
					Los jugadores entablaron un partido divididos en el equipo rojo y el blanco.
					
					Esta competencia sirvio de una oportunidad para profundizar el sentimiento de amistad entre los pueblos, jovenes y ninos escolares de ambos paises.
